DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to investigate levels of progesterone in the luteal phase after various stimulations in the follicular phase and treatment with GnRH antagonist protocol followed by GnRHagonist as induction of ovulation.
DOC.brief_title: The Luteal Phase After GnRHa Trigger - a Proof of Concept Study
DOC.detailed_description: The purpose of this study is to investigate levels of progesterone in the luteal phase after various stimulations in the follicular phase and treatment with GnRH antagonist protocol followed by GnRHagonist as induction of ovulation. Furthermore the aim is to explore whether the luteal phase can be supported with small daily boluses of hCG without the administration of exogenous P, while maintaining good reproductive outcome.
DOC.criteria: women from the age of 25 up to 40 SerumFSH and serumLH levels under 12 IU/L Length of period between 25 and 34 days BMI between 18 and 30 less than 2 ovaries uterine abnormalities PCOS or ULPCO (more than 11 follicles over 12 mm in 1 ovary
